reviews.text: The Andersia is a very nice and modern hotel, with up-to-date facilities and good staff. I have been in several hotels in Poznan and this would be my numer 1 option. They have a great pool and spa too, that is a plus for relaxing in the evenings after a work day.
reviews.title: Best option in Poznan

reviews.text: The hotel is at walking distance of the central square and has a big shopping center with shops and restaurants across the street.
reviews.title: Excellent for business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IBB Andersia is excellent for short or long business trip. Very good buffe breakfast, good quality restaurant and excellent beds (good sleep quality). Therre are some minor disadvantages like: you cannot swith off AC in the room, bathroom has glass walls (and if you face next building which is 20 m away... you better sit in dark room)
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel. Only stayed the one night, could have easily stayed for longer. Exceptionally clean throughout, very friendly staff, rooms were super cool. Situated in a very good location. Don't hesitate to book this hotel just do it.
reviews.title: Comfortable with great localization

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place in the centre of the city with a nice view on the "Stary Browar". Comfortable hotel with good facilities like Spa treatments and swimmingpool area. Very friendly, helpful and descreet staff in the hotel.
reviews.title: excellent hotel and very central

reviews.text: I have booked the IBB via hrs cause I wanted to have a nice wellness area on a holiday - no one told me, that the wellness area is closed on 1st Nov. It could be a very nice hotel, but it is not really clean for a 4 star hotel and a lot of things destroy the design e.g. cleaning apperal standing in design areas...
reviews.title: a good design basis totally destroyed by the service

likes.liked: — wellness area- if open - not opened on Polish holidays!!!

reviews.text: The restaurant is the worst I have ever been to! Old prepared food(!) still frozen when served...after a long journey, we were so hungry that we ate some of it anyways, but the next day we had a lot of stomach problems....
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and excellent staff throughout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked over 300 guests into this hotel over the course of the summer in two groups. No complaints from any, most of them discerning travellers. Any small issues we had were dealt with promptly and efficiently. Hotel Director Marcin runs a very tight ship, many people would do well to follow his excellent leadership
reviews.title: Modern high quality skyscraper hotel

likes.disliked: — Badly designed bathroom, slippery floors in pool changing rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i look forward to returning in 2009
reviews.title: It is simply perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The IBB has opened since we were in Poznan a year ago. It is Spanish owned and located next door to the Novotel where we stayed then. It occupies the lower 9 floors of a tower block. Both hotels directly face the nicely converted brewery which is now a huge shopping mall.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: I went to poznan for a weekend to visit a friend and i stayed at this hotel. Overall very good. The room was excelent with a very nice view. Next to the downtown just some minutes walk, in front of the hotel you have the big mall with a lot of stores.
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect location

reviews.text: I could not visit the pool but seeing overall hotel it should be great. The price is also good i got a fly + hotel package. Just the taxi from hotel to airport was quite expensive for a 7 km way i paid 80 plz. You sure can get a taxi for a cheaper price than that.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: by the way nice city with a nice night life.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel at a good location. Great interior - great value for price. A very welcome competitor to the novotel next door !
reviews.title: Chic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only 5 mins drive / 15 mins walk to the charming Old Town of Poznan this hotel could not have been better located - right opposite the award winning Old Brewery shopping centre. Rooms were spacious, extremely clean, modern and with excellent views (mine was on 7th floor). Great buffet breakfast - both continental and English. Interestingly designed bar with friendly staff taking care of you until early hours of the morning. Perfect for a business trip or a city break. Only 20 mins drive from the airport which costs less than £10!
reviews.title: WONDERFUL

likes.disliked: — pool was not open which we knew before going

reviews.text: I was completely blown away by this hotel. From the moment I arrived and checked in, the staff were extremely helpfula nd the hotel was beautiful. When I arrived and I was taken upt o my room - whcih wasnt ready, I was immediately upgraded to a superior room, whcih was lovely. The room was huge, with a huge picture window overlooking the city. The furnishings were stylish and the bathroom was fantastic, although the sound system was louder than expected! The free minibar was also great even though it only contained soft drinks it is the first time I have ever come across a free minibar in a hotel having stayed in hotels all over the world, this is such a rarity that none of my colleagues believed me when I told them. I also appreciated the free wifi in my room. I am baffled why so many hotels see internet provision as an opportunity to gouge their guests when free internet is so appreciated and costs the hotel so little that it must be one of the greatest forms of guest retention there is.
reviews.title: Luxury and brilliant value in the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious and the service in the restaurant was excellent. The hotel is fantastically positioned within easy reach of the city centre, and the old town and stands opposite a huge brand new shopping centre.
reviews.title: Positively surprised

reviews.text: A lovely hotel in a brilliant location with great staff and fantastic value for money - what more could you ask for?
reviews.title: Love at first stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While driving to Warsaw in December 2009 we were forced to look for a place to stay overnight. We booked a room at the Andersia hotel because we knew the name through a friend. We did not have any big expectations and were very positively surprised. The nice experience started already at check in where we were pleasantly greeted and very quickly checked in. The room was very modern, clean and comfortable. The room-service we ordered was quickly delivered and the breakfast buffet was quite big and varied. In short - great value for money and very friendly service! The hotel is located right next to the Stary Browar shopping mall - one of the best and most original malls in Europe - a definite must see!
reviews.title: Modern, peaceful retreat in the centre of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Andersia is perfectly located very close to Poznan's Old Town, railway station and Fairs - practically all the interesting places are in the walking distance, and right next to the hotel there's a big shopping mall. Hotel itself is very modern, quite roomy and very comfortable. Another big advantage is very nice SPA area with steam room and sauna. There's also small but nice swimming pool. Check-in and check-out process is always very efficient and swift. Staff is youg and very helpful. Breakfasts are quite generous. It's my number 1 choice in Poznan.
reviews.title: Central and Luxurious

reviews.text: I generally like a safe bet with hotels, so often stay in well known chain hotels. The excellent comments about this hotel and the moderate pricing however lead me here - and I was certainly not disappointed. The rooms were spacious and very well appointed with a small free minibar of water and soft drinks and free internet. Bed was super comfortable and bathroom very nice. The hotel had a great gym/swimming pool as well. The check-in / check-out was effortless and reception staff went the extra distance to be helpful when I had enquiries about rail tickets. Overall it was a great experience and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Thanks Tripadvisor!

reviews.text: Was booked in here as Domina was closing. I have never felt more comfortable ay any hotel anywhere. Room was huge by european standards. Computer downstairs. Room was very clean and luxerious. Of my 2 weeks in Poland the most comfortable nights were spent here. Yes I would stay here again
reviews.title: really a 5 star

reviews.text: Stayed here in Aug 2009 for 4 nights. This must qualify as the best hotel I have ever stayed in. We secured a cheap deal by UK pricing standards and stayed on a B&B basis. Rooms were large and spacious with a lovely bathroom contained within a glass cubicle (blinds are provided so that Poznan does not have to watch you shower...).
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location
Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent as were the leisure facilities. The pool is a bit chilly however but soon refreshes you! Lockers are provided and a towel and key can be collected from the leisure suite reception.
The hotel is situated across the road from the Stary Browar shopping mall. The mall is spotless and worth a visit. The town square (Stary Rynek) is a 10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Excellent Andersia

reviews.text: Spent two nights here on a business trip. The hotel is modern and tastefully designed and the staff were welcoming and efficient and could all speak good English. They were helpful with directions and other advice and handed out maps etc.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel in Excellent Location

reviews.text: There are two computer terminals in the reception are offering free access to the internet and WIFI is available in the rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - good location

reviews.text: Rooms are of a modern design and the bathrooms are well equipped with good quality fittings. The bathroom in my room on the 7th floor had glass walls, although it did have blinds to protect your modesty!
reviews.title: The best price/quality ratio in Poznan, great location, some flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used the restaurant only once (at lunchtime) and enjoyed the meal which was freshly cooked and was good value. Breakfast, which is served on the first floor, is the usual self service affair and food was quite plentiful and adequate.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms and amenities. Housekeeping a bit annoying.

reviews.text: The hotel is well located and there is a tremendous shopping centre just across the road from the hotel offering numerous up-market shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: really nice hotel in centre

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel - very helpful staff! I only stayed one night, but wish I could have stayed longer (my previous hotel the night before in Vienna was terrible - this was a very pleasant experience). My only "complaint" was the water in the shower was not consistent - but overall, it was very minor. It is also right across the street from a very nice mall (not that I had time to do any shopping, but it did have a Starbucks!)
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

reviews.text: Time after time to be greated by professional and friendly staff is a real pleasure. The rooms are modern and relatively spacious, although the glass walls of the bathroom are somewhat different to the norm. The business rooms with complementary lounge and drinks is well worth the small extra costs.
reviews.title: excellent, best hotel in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition the spa is of the highest quality as is the level of breakfast provided, The location in the middle of the interesting town allows sightseeing on foot without any problems at all.
reviews.title: Splendid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short the best hotel in town
reviews.title: Modern design in Poland

reviews.text: Great value for money in Poznan.
reviews.title: Incredibly modern, in beautifull Poznan

reviews.text: Recently stayed on business for 2 nights, Staff very helpful on check in. Room very clean and tidy good furniture and very comfortable bed. Mini bar in room has a range of soft drinks which are complimentary and re stocked everyday. Bathroom very well appointed with walk in shower. Nice bar good selection of drinks and staff very good. The hotel is situated about 10 min walk from the old square which is worth a visit with its various bars and restaurants and lovely buildings. Very good wide selection for buffet breakfast and again very efficient staff. My return flight was late afternoon and was allowed to keep my room until 13.00 hrs at no extra cost. My only comment was that the english news service channels in the morning were limited, I know I should learn more Polish. A very good hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Staff

reviews.text: After staying at Hotel Andersia, I was totally excited. The room was absolutely clean and the furnitures have got a modern style. Especially the benches directly at the windows were great and comfortable. The drinks of the minibar, tee and coffee were free of charge. The Breakfast was also great. You have a big choice of different fruits and other foods. Unfortunately I was not able to visit the spa area, but the pool was also included in the room price. Wifi is availible in all rooms without any limit.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have ever seen!
Very good hotel great location/great staff
reviews.text: Great hotel, lovely bar and really good food. Really impressed with everything about this hotel. Would go back again
Excellent hotel. A very good 4 star. One of the best hotels I have stayed in.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.text: I stay at this hotel quite regualy and am always pleased by the facilities on offer. The rooms are large and well equipped. The pool area is great. Having spent many an hour at the lobby bar, i can confirm that the staff are always welcoming and friendly.
reviews.title: Great pool
